verses.text: Truly God \add is\add* good to Israel, \add Even\add* to such as are of a clean heart.
But \add as for\add* me, my feet were almost gone; My steps had well nigh slipt.
For I was envious at the foolish, \add When\add* I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
For \add there are\add* no bands in their death: But their strength \add is\add* firm.
They \add are\add* not in trouble \add as other\add* men; Neither are they plagued like \add other\add* men.
Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; Violence covereth them \add as\add* a garment.
Their eyes stand out with fatness: They have more than heart could wish.
They are corrupt, and speak wickedly \add concerning\add* oppression: They speak loftily.
They set their mouth against the heavens, And their tongue walketh through the earth.
Therefore his people return hither: And waters of a full \add cup\add* are wrung out to them.
And they say, How doth God know? And is there knowledge in the most High?
Behold, these \add are\add* the ungodly, Who prosper in the world; they increase \add in\add* riches.
Verily I have cleansed my heart \add in\add* vain, And washed my hands in innocency.
For all the day long have I been plagued, And chastened every morning.
If I say, I will speak thus; Behold, I should offend \add against\add* the generation of thy children.
When I thought to know this, It \add was\add* too painful for me;
Until I went into the sanctuary of God; \add Then\add* understood I their end.
Surely thou didst set them in slippery \add places:\add* Thou castedst them down into destruction.
How are they \add brought\add* into desolation, as \add in\add* a moment! They are utterly consumed with terrors.
As a dream when \add one\add* awaketh; \add So\add*, O Lord, when \add thou\add* awakest, thou shalt despise their image.
Thus my heart was grieved, And I was pricked \add in\add* my reins.
So foolish \add was\add* I, and ignorant: I was \add as\add* a beast before thee.
Nevertheless I \add am\add* continually with thee: Thou hast holden \add me\add* by my right hand.
Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, And afterward receive me \add to\add* glory.
Whom have I in heaven \add but thee?\add* And \add there is\add* none upon earth \add that\add* I desire besides thee.
My flesh and my heart faileth: \add But\add* God \add is\add* the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.
For lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: Thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.
But \add it is\add* good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord \sc God\sc*, That \add I\add* may declare all thy works.
